head.title: Teenagers Should Talk About Both Fat and Thin

hedline.hl1: Teenagers Should Talk About Both Fat and Thin

abstract.p: D C Chesler letter, commenting on Dec 19 article about teenager girls learning to resist pressures to to be thin, says the girls should also be made aware of hazards of obesity

block.p: The teenager in Felicia R. Lee's Dec. 19 Coping column (''The Body Beautiful, in Diverse Guises'') may not ''explode.'' However, she may be headed for serious health problems. It is not O.K. to overeat or ignore proper diet. Obesity is a serious health problem, particularly in children. It is prevalent in minority communities.

It is not O.K. to overeat or ignore proper diet. Obesity is a serious health problem, particularly in children. It is prevalent in minority communities.

So, indeed, talk about why we are obsessed with thinness. But its unhealthy opposite is certainly something to be discussed, too. Sass is good, but is it covering up some serious denial? An important service might be provided if Sista II Sista educated its members about good eating and the devastating potential negative health consequences and lost productivity associated with obesity later in life.
